Posts.Content: purplejc5 wrote: I just had my right breast lumpectomy on April 4th. I feel I am doing much better than I thought I would do. Just taking Extra Strength Tylenol 3 days after surgery. From what my husband says my surgeon took 3 tumors instead of the 3 that they saw and removed 4 lymph nodes. I’m hoping he was being cautious and not because there was more than he thought. I guess my fear is now, did I make the right decision? It seemed right at the time. Here I am waiting again-Lymph Node results. I will get those on Tuesday. I hate waiting Dx 3/6/2019, DCIS, Right, Stage 0 Dx 3/19/2019, DCIS/IDC, Right, Stage 0, Grade 1 Surgery 4/4/2019 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for Lymph Node results purplejc5 purplejc5

Posts.Content: May 23, 2019 09:42PM purplejc5 wrote: Hello Ladies; I started my radiation on May 16th, so I’m 6 treatments in. So far so good. Just waiting for the other shoe to drop as far as side effects go. Tech said it probably won’t happen till the 8th-9th treatment. I’m putting on Aquaphore, sometimes Aloe Vera gel (if I can’t stand the stickiness). I’m doing whole breast, 16 treatments with 4 boosts. Let’s all hang in there together. This too shall pass
Posts.Title: Radiation May 2019 Barbjc Barbjc

I wanted some of you ladies that have been down this road have used and works. I want to use something over the counter, if possible. I also thought i read that cool cloths help soothe after radiation also. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated Dx 3/6/2019, DCIS, Right, Stage 0 Dx 3/19/2019, DCIS/IDC, Right, Stage 0, Grade 1 Surgery 4/4/2019 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lotions and Creams purplejc5 Ingerp

Posts.Content: purplejc5 wrote: Hi Ladies; I am about to start my radiation treatment next week. My Oncologist gave me a choice-16 treatments or 25 treatments both with 4 boosts. I chose the 16 treatments and was confident in my decision. I am trying to think positively that my SE’s would be minimal. I went for my CT Scan and tattoo markings today and told the radio tech what my decision was. He proceeded to tell me how much I was going to burn (I’m larger breasted) and told me I didn’t need to put on my cream of choice (Aquaphore) until after I got home and I wouldn’t like Aquaphore because it is “gummy”. I’m trying so hard to make choices according to the great info I’ve gotten from this site and staying positive. Now I’m questioning everything I thought I would do. Please help with your experiences and any tips would be greatly appreciated. Especially woman that have shorter but more concentrated treatment Dx 3/6/2019, DCIS, Right, Stage 0 Dx 3/19/2019, DCIS/IDC, Right, Stage 0, Grade 1 Surgery 4/4/2019 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Right Log in to post a reply
